The '''Quaternary Period''' is the most recent of the three [[period (geology)|periods]] of the [[Cenozoic]] [[Era]] in the [[geologic time scale]] of the [[International Commission on Stratigraphy|ICS]].<ref name="ICS2009"/> It follows the [[Neogene]] Period, spanning 2.588 Â± 0.005 million yrs. ago to the present. The Quaternary includes two geologic [[epoch (geology)|epochs]]: the [[Pleistocene]] and the [[Holocene]].

The '''Quaternary Period''' is the most recent of the three [[period (geology)|periods]] of the [[Cenozoic]] [[Era]] in the [[geologic time scale]] of the [[International Commission on Stratigraphy|ICS]].<ref name="ICS2009"/> It follows the [[Neogene]] Period, spanning 2.588 Â± 0.005 million years ago to the present. The Quaternary includes two geologic [[epoch (geology)|epochs]]: the [[Pleistocene]] and the [[Holocene]].
